data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly for Antitrust Violations
data.Description: A federal judge ruled that Google maintains an illegal monopoly in the search market by using anti-competitive tactics, such as paying billions to Apple and other companies to be the default search engine.

data.Title: Apple Confirms Proprietary Search Engine Indexing Billions of Websites
data.Description: Court documents from the recent Google antitrust case revealed that Apple maintains its own search index encompassing billions of websites, fueling speculation about the tech giant's future search engine plans.

data.Title: Apple Rejects Bing as Default Search Engine, Even for "the Whole Company"
data.Description: Apple's senior vice president of software engineering, Craig Federighi, affirmed that the company would not consider replacing Google with Bing as the default search engine on Safari, even if Microsoft offered its entire company.

data.Title: Google Local Service Ads Now Feature Photos to Enhance Visibility
data.Description: Google announced that Local Service Ads will now showcase photos from advertisers' profiles, aiming to improve ad engagement and performance by providing a more visually appealing experience for users.

data.Title: Google Ads Experiences Glitch, Issues Million-Dollar Credits by Mistake
data.Description: A bug in Google Ads resulted in some advertisers receiving credit notices worth millions of dollars. Google acknowledged the error and assured users that it was working to rectify the situation.

data.Title: Google Search Testing New "You May Like" Snippet Labels
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a new "You May Like" label in search result snippets, potentially leveraging user browsing history and preferences to deliver more personalized recommendations.

data.Title: Google Tests Redirecting "More Videos" Clicks to Dedicated Tab
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a change to how users access additional videos in search results, potentially replacing the dynamic loading of videos with a redirect to a dedicated "Short Videos" tab.

data.Title: Google Ads API Version 17.1 Released with New Features
data.Description: Google has launched version 17.1 of the Google Ads API, introducing new functionalities such as shareable ad previews and the removal of specific automatically generated assets for Responsive Search Ads.

data.Title: Google Search Console Introduces Site Improvement Recommendations
data.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out a new feature that provides website owners with personalized recommendations for improving their site's performance in search results, based on data collected by the platform.

data.Title: Google Ads to Integrate Smart Campaigns into Performance Max
data.Description: Google Ads will be transitioning the features of Smart Campaigns into Performance Max campaigns in the coming months, aiming to streamline campaign management and enhance advertising effectiveness.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Performance Report No Longer Displays Call Data
data.Description: The "call" tab, which provided statistics and data on calls originating from Google Search and Google Maps, has been removed from the Google Business Profiles performance report.

data.Title: Google Ads Tests Displaying Advertiser Names in Call Extensions
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a new call extension ad format that prominently features the advertiser's name below the clickable phone number, aiming to increase visibility and encourage calls from potential customers.

data.Title: Google Ads Explores "Featured Options" Search Ad Format
data.Description: Google Ads is potentially testing a new search ad format called "featured options," which presents ad listings in card layouts, possibly related to events or specific search queries.

data.Title: Google Trends Unveils Redesigned Trending Now Page
data.Description: Google Trends has introduced a redesigned interface for its trending now page, offering users enhanced filtering options and a more comprehensive presentation of keyword data.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Tests "See Also" Carousel Featuring Competitors
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a "see also" carousel on Google Business Profiles, potentially displaying competitor suggestions directly beneath a business's local listing.

data.Title: Microsoft Integrates AI into Bing Search Engine
data.Description: Microsoft has enhanced its Bing search engine with artificial intelligence capabilities, enabling AI-curated responses to queries and prioritizing publisher interests and accuracy over revenue generation.
